column1: # LibreQoS Shaped Devices Configuration Example
# This file demonstrates the CSV format for defining shaped devices (circuits) in LibreQoS.
# As of LibreQoS v1.5+
column2: fractional bandwidth rates are supported for more granular control.

column1: # Rate Fields Support Decimal Values:
# - Download Min Mbps: Minimum download rate (≥ 0.1 Mbps) - supports decimals like 0.5
# - Upload Min Mbps: Minimum upload rate (≥ 0.1 Mbps) - supports decimals like 0.5
# - Download Max Mbps: Maximum download rate (≥ 0.2 Mbps) - supports decimals like 10.5
# - Upload Max Mbps: Maximum upload rate (≥ 0.2 Mbps) - supports decimals like 10.5
# TC Command Generation:
# - Rates < 1 Mbps: Converted to kbit (e.g.
# - Rates 1-999 Mbps: Use mbit units (e.g.
# - Rates ≥ 1000 Mbps: Use gbit units (e.g.
# Backward Compatibility: Existing integer rates continue to work unchanged.
# Per‑Circuit SQM Override (last column `sqm`):
# - Accepts: "cake"
# - Directional form: left token applies to download
column2: right to upload. Either side may be empty

column1: #   to indicate no override for that direction (e.g.
# - Case is ignored on load; values are normalized to trimmed
# - "none" on a side disables the SQM qdisc for that direction.
# - When a side is unspecified (empty) or the entire field is empty
#   default SQM for that side and still applies the fast‑queue threshold (fq_codel) per direction.
Circuit ID
